dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in early 2021, GameStop's volatility was absolutely wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in early twenty twenty one, GameStop's volatility was absolutely wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meme stocks such as GameStop experienced massive volatility over the last quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it wasn't even retail investors causing the real damage—it was institutional players coordinating those short squeezes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it wasn't even retail investors causing the real damage-it was institutional players coordinating those short squeezes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail investors gave severe nose bleeds to hedge funds which built short positions in GameStop. A lot of this was chiefly due to the fact that retail traders took opposite bets against hedge funds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, hedge funds got hit hard. And then you had Tesla Bitcoin move—they liquidated their holdings, which was a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, hedge funds got hit hard. And then you had Tesla Bitcoin move-they liquidated their holdings, which was a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nevertheless, it will not be changing that digital currency back into fiat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That triggered a whole sell-off from other S&P companies too, didn't it? Regulatory pressure just killed the momentum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That triggered a whole sell-off from other S&P companies too, didn't it? Regulatory pressure just killed the momentum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then there's that whole SPAC craze cooling off—over 50 this year, some with big names like LeBron James backing them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then there's that whole S P A C craze cooling off-over fifty this year, some with big names like LeBron James backing them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have had 250+ SPACs so far this year, and celebrities and sports personalities are backing them up as sponsors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even Warren Buffett got in on a SPAC, with Venus Williams on the board. But the hype definitely faded.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even Warren Buffett got in on a S P A C, with Venus Williams on the board. But the hype definitely faded.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors like Cathie Wood, from ARK Investment Management LLC, also bought a SPAC with tennis star Serena Williams on the board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, sector rotation was massive—tech stocks outperformed thanks to those soaring Treasury yields.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, sector rotation was massive-tech stocks outperformed thanks to those soaring Treasury yields.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Soaring Treasury yields and concerns about rising inflation made investors sell tech stocks during the first quarter. The Nasdaq Composite index is certainly the laggard among the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then Archegos Capital… major banks like Goldman Sachs gave them low leverage, but they still blew up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Archegos Capital... major banks like Goldman Sachs gave them low leverage, but they still blew up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Archegos Capital Management was given excessive leverage by major banks such as Credit Suisse, Deutsche Bank and many more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Forced to buy up tech positions in Facebook, Apple—sent those stocks soaring and banks made record profits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forced to buy up tech positions in Facebook, Apple-sent those stocks soaring and banks made record profits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The family office was forced to sell its tech positions in media companies such as Tencent Music, ViacomCBS, Discovery and Baidu. Shares of these companies plunged, and this also made banks like Credit Suisse issue grave profit warnings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And all while stimulus money—that $1.9 trillion package—didn't even really flow into the market like people thought.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all while stimulus money-that one point nine dollars trillion package-didn't even really flow into the market like people thought.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We haven't so far seen much evidence that this money is coming into the market, despite several banks producing their estimates of how much of the stimulus check money could be heading towards the stock market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, estimates were lowered, nearly $19 billion expected to reduce market activity instead.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, estimates were lowered, nearly nineteen dollars billion expected to reduce market activity instead.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has been stated that nearly $190 billion of the stimulus money could boost the stock market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Then Biden's new $2 trillion tax cut plan—Democrats control Congress, but infrastructure spending might not get full support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then Biden's new two dollars trillion tax cut plan-Democrats control Congress, but infrastructure spending might not get full support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Biden revealed his new infrastructure stimulus plan of $2 trillion yesterday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Republicans will back the tax cuts though, so less money pumped in overall. Traders are just hooked on that kind of stimulus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Republicans will back the tax cuts though, so less money pumped in overall. Traders are just hooked on that kind of stimulus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lawmakers know that the economy needs infrastructure upgrades, so we are likely to see more money pumped into the system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the SEC's probably gonna go easier on family offices now, but leverage rules will stay tight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the S E C's probably gonna go easier on family offices now, but leverage rules will stay tight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SEC is likely to adopt a tougher stance on family offices to avoid any systematic risk to the financial system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, after all that, it's hard to see retail forums like Reddit keeping that kind of momentum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, after all that, it's hard to see retail forums like Reddit keeping that kind of momentum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We may likely see the social forums such as Wallstreetbets picking up momentum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Retail traders just don't have the capital to move markets like institutions do.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Retail traders just don't have the capital to move markets like institutions do.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key point to keep in mind is that we can no longer discount the strength of retail money. After all, retail traders do have money, and they will invest it somewhere.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in early 2021, GameStop's volatility was absolutely wild.
HostB: Yeah, and it wasn't even retail investors causing the real damage—it was institutional players coordinating those short squeezes.
HostA: Right, hedge funds got hit hard. And then you had Tesla Bitcoin move—they liquidated their holdings, which was a huge deal.
HostB: That triggered a whole sell-off from other S&P companies too, didn’t it? Regulatory pressure just killed the momentum.
HostA: Exactly. And then there’s that whole SPAC craze cooling off—over 50 this year, some with big names like LeBron James backing them.
HostB: Even Warren Buffett got in on a SPAC, with Venus Williams on the board. But the hype definitely faded.
HostA: Meanwhile, sector rotation was massive—tech stocks outperformed thanks to those soaring Treasury yields.
HostB: And then Archegos Capital… major banks like Goldman Sachs gave them low leverage, but they still blew up.
HostA: Forced to buy up tech positions in Facebook, Apple—sent those stocks soaring and banks made record profits.
HostB: And all while stimulus money—that $1.9 trillion package—didn’t even really flow into the market like people thought.
HostA: Yeah, estimates were lowered, nearly $19 billion expected to reduce market activity instead.
HostB: Then Biden’s new $2 trillion tax cut plan—Democrats control Congress, but infrastructure spending might not get full support.
HostA: Republicans will back the tax cuts though, so less money pumped in overall. Traders are just hooked on that kind of stimulus.
HostB: And the SEC’s probably gonna go easier on family offices now, but leverage rules will stay tight.
HostA: Honestly, after all that, it’s hard to see retail forums like Reddit keeping that kind of momentum.
HostB: For sure. Retail traders just don’t have the capital to move markets like institutions do.
